Inference: Quadruple-confirmed high-confidence leak event
Description: Simultaneous occurrence of leak detection, flow anomalies, temperature deviation, and device activation provides the highest reliability that a real leak event has occurred.
short rationale: Fully detailed incident with timing, location, and mitigation actions; strong reconstruction and profiling risk.

Inference: Freeze–burst rupture classification
Description: Sub-freezing temperatures followed by strong flow anomalies, leak detection, and immediate device activation confirm freeze–burst pipe ruptures.
short rationale: Identifies freeze ruptures with activation timing; high event specificity but limited occupant inference.

Inference: Overheat-induced leak classification
Description: High temperature readings with flow anomalies, leak detection, and device activation indicate overheating-driven seal or pipe failures.
short rationale: Overheating failure episodes tied to activation logs; reveals hazardous events and responses.

Inference: Distinguishing pressure-driven leaks from thermal-driven leaks
Description: Flow anomalies appearing before temperature deviation and leak detection suggest pressure-driven leaks, while temperature changes preceding flow anomalies indicate thermal-driven failures.
short rationale: Classifies cause via signal order; moderate incident detail without deep personal exposure.

Inference: Detecting false leak detections using flow–temperature–device mismatches
Description: Leak detections without corresponding flow anomalies, temperature deviation, or device activation are strong indicators of false positives.
short rationale: Flags false alarms with timestamps; low behavioral inference.

Inference: Identifying concealed or insulated pipe failures
Description: Flow anomalies and leak detection with minimal temperature deviation but accompanied by device activation indicate leaks hidden behind insulation or inside walls.
short rationale: Reveals hidden leak locations and activation timing; event-specific location sensitivity.

Inference: Evaluating device responsiveness to thermally hazardous leaks
Description: If device activation occurs significantly after flow anomalies and leak detection during extreme temperatures, it indicates delayed response to hazardous conditions.
short rationale: Operational responsiveness metric during risky events; limited personal inference but includes event timelines.

Inference: Identifying heater or valve malfunctions
Description: Flow anomalies and device activation at elevated temperatures without leak detection reveal malfunctioning heaters or valves causing abnormal flow.
short rationale: Points to appliance/valve issues with activation logs; moderate exposure of usage times.

Inference: Recognizing micro-leaks influenced by temperature cycles
Description: Small flow anomalies with leak detection only during temperature extremes signal thermally induced micro-leaks.
short rationale: Recurring micro-leaks tied to temperature cycles; exposes persistent zone-level issues and timing.

Inference: Predicting leak occurrence using thermal–flow precursor patterns
Description: Temperature deviation followed by small recurrent flow anomalies and later leak detection indicates developing thermally stressed leak points.
short rationale: Precursors plus eventual detection enable forward-looking risk per zone; event timelines included.

Inference: Localizing leaks using combined thermal gradient and flow onset
Description: The zone showing earliest temperature deviation and earliest flow anomaly provides clues to the exact leak origin before device activation.
short rationale: Pinpoints origin via earliest signals; high location sensitivity and reconstruction risk.

Inference: Tri-signal severity scoring for leak prioritization
Description: Leak severity can be ranked using flow magnitude, thermal deviation intensity, and the immediacy and escalation of device activation.
short rationale: Severity score per incident across three signals; detailed but primarily technical.

Inference: Differentiating appliance-related anomalies from leaks
Description: High-temperature flow anomalies without moisture data but with device activation and no leak detection indicate appliance discharge rather than structural leaks.
short rationale: Attributes events to appliance use vs. leaks, revealing occupant activity patterns.

Inference: Identifying intermittent thermally induced leaks
Description: Leaks detected only during temperature extremes and accompanied by flow anomalies and device activation represent intermittent leaks caused by thermal expansion or contraction.
short rationale: Intermittent events with activation logs and temperature context; notable timing and location exposure.

Inference: Evaluating repair durability under thermal and hydraulic loads
Description: Recurring leak detections and flow anomalies during temperature swings after repairs indicate repairs that fail under thermal or hydraulic stress.
short rationale: Links events to post-repair periods and temperature swings; reveals maintenance effectiveness history.

Inference: Detecting pressure regulator or pump failure
Description: Oscillating flow anomalies at extreme temperatures that repeatedly trigger device activation suggest faulty pressure regulators or pumps.
short rationale: Infrastructure performance issue with activation repeats; moderate incident detail.

Inference: Thermal masking of early leak-related flow anomalies
Description: Cold temperatures can reduce flow anomaly magnitude; leak detection and activation occurring at small flow anomalies signal temperature-masked leaks.
short rationale: Captures subtle incidents masked by cold with activation logs; event-specific risk.

Inference: Identifying cascading failure events
Description: Temperature deviation → flow anomaly → leak detection → sequential device activations indicates cascading system failure.
short rationale: Rich multi-stage timelines and activation order expose detailed failure progression.

Inference: Separating structural leaks from pressure surges
Description: Flow anomalies at high temperature without leak detection but with device activation indicate pressure surges, whereas similar patterns with leak detection confirm structural leakage.
short rationale: Distinguishes cause using patterns; moderate sensitivity without deep identity exposure.

Inference: Temporal fingerprinting for automated leak-type classification
Description: Patterns such as temperature spike → flow anomaly → leak detection → activation define overheating leaks, while cold dip → flow anomaly → activation → leak detection defines freeze-related leaks.
short rationale: Signal order fingerprints leak types; detailed sequences useful for profiling incidents.

Inference: Validating leak sensor performance during thermal extremes
Description: If leak detection fails during extreme temperatures while flow anomalies and device activations occur, sensors are insensitive under thermal stress.
short rationale: Performance check under extremes; limited privacy impact beyond event timestamps.

Inference: Detecting leaks suppressed temporarily by thermal expansion
Description: High temperatures may initially seal micro-cracks; flow anomalies and device activation that occur only during cooling periods indicate leaks unmasked by contraction.
short rationale: Captures temperature-dependent leak appearance with activation timing; incident-specific.

Inference: Assessing post-activation hydraulic stabilization
Description: After device activation, flow anomalies should decrease; failure to stabilize indicates ongoing rupture or insufficient mitigation.
short rationale: Post-activation monitoring per incident; moderate exposure of event timelines.

Inference: Mapping temperature-sensitive leak zones
Description: Zones where leak detection, flow anomalies, and device activation repeatedly correlate with temperature extremes are high-risk thermal zones requiring insulation or redesign.
short rationale: Maps vulnerable zones with repeated events and activations; high location and history sensitivity.
